channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-13828] Add group permissions testing coverage to AC.
item.description: We suffered a regression HBASE-13826 recently due to lack of testing coverage for group permissions for AC. With the recent perf boost provided by HBASE-13658, it wouldn't be a bad idea to add checks for group level users to applicable unit tests in TestAccessController.
item.summary: Add group permissions testing coverage to AC.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Shall I work on it ?
Go ahead.
Thanks

Attached patch for master branch.
Please review.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12737480/HBASE-13828.patch
against master branch at commit bb62d5b2e8db1677568723bb8d0d8ea4fd2c6f46.
ATTACHMENT ID: 12737480

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 12 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop versions. The patch compiles with all supported hadoop versions (2.4.1 2.5.2 2.6.0)

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 protoc. The applied patch does not increase the total number of protoc compiler warnings.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 checkstyle. The applied patch does not increase the total number of checkstyle errors

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

-1 lineLengths. The patch introduces the following lines longer than 100:
+ verifyAllowed(action, SUPERUSER, USER_ADMIN, USER_OWNER, USER_CREATE, USER_RW, TESTGROUP_W_USER);
+ verifyDenied(appendAction, USER_RO, USER_NONE, TESTGROUP_C_USER, TESTGROUP_R_USER,TESTGROUP_A_USER);

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

-1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:

This message is automatically generated.
Ping for reviews!

Don't call convertToGroup(String) every time we need an object. Make the test groups in setup like we make the test users.

—

The new constants look a bit strange because they don't follow how the others were named.

TESTGROUP_x -> Consider GROUP_xxx. Example: TESTGROUP_R -> GROUP_READ.

TESTGROUP_x_USER -> Consider USER_GROUP_xxx. Example: TESTGROUP_R_USER -> USER_GROUP_READ.

It's minor but it improves the readability of the test.

—

Patches look good otherwise.

Thanks for the review.
Attached v2 patch addressing your readability comments.

This message is automatically generated.
Can we use TEST_GROUP_1 by changing its value to convertToGroup("testgroup_1") instead of creating a new variable testGroup1GroupName? Other than that, patch is looking good to me.

Thanks for the review.

Can we use TEST_GROUP_1 by changing its value to convertToGroup("testgroup_1") instead of creating a new variable testGroup1GroupName?

But still then either we need to have local variable with value {{"testgroup_1"} or use it directly when creating the user(s) for this group. We are using that name here


TESTGROUP1_USER1 =

        User.createUserForTesting(conf, "testgroup1_user1", new String[] { TESTGROUP_1 });
Srikanth Srungarapu, I will wait for your reply on above comment before posting other version patches.
How about using something like TESTGROUP1_NAME?
ok. I will make that change in the next version of my patch.
Please review.
Attached patches for all the versions and will delete older patches except for master.

Latest patches lgtm, will commit later today unless Srikanth Srungarapu has additional comments.
+1 on latest patches.
Thanks, committing now
Earlier when I applied the patches the branch-1.0 patch failed a test. So I'm just going to apply the v3 master patch, which passes, and then pick it back to the branches myself.
Pushed

Thanks for the reviews.
Andrew Purtell Which test is failing on branch-1.0 ?
Even Hadoop QA did not report any valid failures for this branch. But I will recheck locally 3-4 times again and see if anything fails if not I will reattach the same patch here again to see if this time it has got anything to report.
We're good. It may have been a misapplied patch. However what I committed passed all tests in o.a.h.h.security.access.* on all branches.
Thanks again.
